clinical_study.brief_title: Transrectal Photoacoustic Imaging of the Prostate
clinical_study.official_title: Transrectal Photoacoustic Imaging of the Prostate

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to image human prostate tissue using a new transrectal photoacoustic imaging probe and correlate this with ultrasound and MRI imaging performed once the specimen has been surgically removed. We hope to see what we can visualize with our device as this has never been done before. Eventually, we hope to use a similar device to image the prostate in men being seen by their doctor for prostate cancer.

primary_outcome.description: Pilot study to better understand the quality of both ultrasound and photo acoustic images that can be obtained using a transrectal instrument. To understand acquisition parameters that help optimize the image quality.

study_pop.textblock: English speaking men at the Palo Alto Veterans Hospital between the ages of 18 and 80 years with clinically localized prostate cancer who desire prostatectomy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- VA male patients of any ethnic background, 18-80 years old, diagnosed with clinically localized prostate cancer who desire prostatectomy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who cannot tolerate a surgical prostatectomy due to medical comorbidities or cannot give informed consent for our study.
